intro: Rhynchophorum floridanum, commonly known as the Florida rhynchophorum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along coastal areas and marshes. It has slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Rhynchophorum floridanum is often found in wetland habitats and is considered an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
